com.fasterxml.util.membuf
Class MemBuffers

java.lang.Object
  com.fasterxml.util.membuf.MemBuffers

public class MemBuffers
extends Object

Container for a set of MemBuffers. Used for constructing MemBuffer instances that all share a single SegmentAllocator instance, and global memory allocation limits (enforced by allocator).

Note that sub-classing is explicitly supported; this is needed to use custom SegmentAllocators, Segments and/or MemBuffers. Default MemBuffers implementation will use default implementations of other components.

Author:
Tatu Saloranta

Constructor Detail

MemBuffers

public MemBuffers(int segmentSize,
                  int segmentsToRetain,
                  int maxSegments)
Constructor that will create a default SegmentAllocator instance with given arguments, and use that allocator for creating MemBuffer instances.

Parameters:
segmentSize - Size of segments allocated for buffers
segmentsToRetain - Maximum number of segments allocator may reuse (see SegmentAllocator for details)
maxSegments - Maximum number of allocated (and not released) segments allowed at any given point (see SegmentAllocator for details)

MemBuffers

public MemBuffers(SegmentAllocator allocator)
Constructor that will pass specified SegmentAllocator for MemBuffer instances it creates.

Parameters:
allocator - Allocator to use for instantiated MemBuffers.
Method Detail

getAllocator

public SegmentAllocator getAllocator()

createBuffer

public MemBuffer createBuffer(int minSegmentsForBuffer,
                              int maxSegmentsForBuffer)
Method that will try to create a MemBuffer with configured allocator, using specified arguments. If construction fails (due to allocation limits), a IllegalStateException will be thrown.

tryCreateBuffer

public MemBuffer tryCreateBuffer(int minSegmentsForBuffer,
                                 int maxSegmentsForBuffer)
Method that will try to create a MemBuffer with configured allocator, using specified arguments. If construction fails (due to allocation limits), null will be returned.

protected MemBuffer _createBuffer(int minSegmentsForBuffer,
                                  int maxSegmentsForBuffer,
                                  Segment initialSegments)
